Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.6693 units. **Part 2** *Shape:* A CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism is slightly tilted to the right. *Dimensions:* The length and width of the prism are approximately 0.55 units, and the height of the prism and cylindrical hole are approximately 0.17 units. *Instructions:* 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1034, 0.1184, 0.4236] 2. Draw the first face of the prism by creating a loop with four lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.1263, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.1263, 0.0], End Point [0.1263, 0.4459] * Line 3: Start Point [0.1263, 0.4459], End Point [0.0, 0.4459] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4459], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. Draw the second face of the prism by creating a loop with one circle: * Circle: Center [0.4291, 0.2805], Radius 0.1246 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5538. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified coordinate system and a scaling factor of 0.5538. 6. Perform a cut extrusion with a depth of 0.1673 units. Note: These instructions assume a left-handed coordinate system with the x-axis pointing to the right, the y-axis pointing up, and the z-axis pointing into the screen. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.1125 towards the normal and 0 towards the opposite direction of normals. The resulting part should be a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a square base and a square top. The length, width, and height of this part are 0.75, 0.75, and 0.1125 units, respectively.</description>
